task_prefix: The Statlog Vehicle Silhouettes dataset contains features extracted from 2D silhouettes of four types of vehicles. The purpose is to classify vehicle silhouettes using shape features extracted by the HIPS (Hierarchical Image Processing System) extension BINATTS, which combines classical moment-based measures and heuristic shape descriptors. Each example contains 18 features. Vehicle type classification from silhouettes for applications in traffic monitoring.

column_descriptions.Compactness measure: (average perimeter)^2/area - measures how compact the shape is
column_descriptions.Circularity measure: (average radius)^2/area - measures how circular the shape is
column_descriptions.Maximum length aspect ratio: Ratio based on maximum length measurements
column_descriptions.Scaled variance along major axis: Second order moment about major axis scaled by area
column_descriptions.Scaled variance along minor axis: Second order moment about minor axis scaled by area
column_descriptions.Skewness about major axis: Third order moment about major axis
column_descriptions.Skewness about minor axis: Third order moment about minor axis
column_descriptions.Kurtosis about major axis: Fourth order moment about major axis
column_descriptions.Kurtosis about minor axis: Fourth order moment about minor axis
column_descriptions.Hollows ratio: Area of hollows/area of bounding polygon
